reviews.review: Probably one of the best games a ever played ( :

the continuation of the adventures of our hero freeman after agreeing to work with g-man, this time the action focuses on the resistance against an alien invasion combine where 20 years ago conquer the earth, an excellent intriguing story where the player's immersion will be guaranteed.

Incredible sequel to the original. The Half Life Series is a must play.

Such a fucking good game holy shit

1. you can beat the game, (duh) has great story, good weapons, and severely decent combat. 2. instead of beating the game, you can do dumb stuff, like spawning 500 Breens and shooting a rocket at them, lags your PC like hell, but still! very fun to mess with the source engine. 3. don't play it past 12:00 AM, you get the chills in alot of sections of the game.     
 So have a great day! and hey, like 10 bucks isnt alot for this masterpiece

Obviously I haven't played the game very long, but I'm barely two hours in and I'm constantly suffering from "Where the hell do I go" syndrome. I can respect it for what it did for gaming, but I don't think this is a game that's meant for me if I'm spending ten minutes trying to figure out what on earth the level expects me to do.

I played this game again because I am re evaluating my top 5 after playing Elden Ring and this game completely stands the test of time and somehow remains one of a kind as its consistent magical qualities have only ever been captured for mere seconds  by other titles since its inception.

This playthrough is making me almost stupid enough to buy an Index to play Alyx.
